textList.name: TEXT_START_AEA_BIRD
textList.text: You have arrived in Gi space. The Gi may not be part of the federation, however they're still close allies and firmly against the rebellion. The Rebellion will still struggle to sneak its way into here.
You have arrived in Gi space. Lots of friendly faces will be here, but there will be plenty of Rebel scum invading as well.
You have arrived in Gi space. This may be a sector full of allies, but it is bound to attract plenty of Rebels too.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_BIRD
event.text: This sector is protected by a combined guard of federation and Gi ships. Several support ships linger in the background, offering aid to other friendly ships in the district.
The guard's captain is shocked that you've turned on them. "You must be a Rebel spy! We won't take this lightly!".
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_BIRD_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Gi would certainly not bat an eye at a ship like yours, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_BIRD_SUPPORT
event.text: The guard puts you on a secure line with one of the nearby support ships, who awaits your command.
Several repair drones are dispatched to repair you.
A refueling drone is dispatched to refuel your ship.
A resupply drone is dispatched to resupply your ship.
A resupply drone is dispatched to resupply your ship.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_BIRD_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Gi guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_BIRD_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Gi guard. Without crew on board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_AEA_BIRD_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Gi guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_AEA_BIRD

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You catch sight of a rare Gi Elite, but they don't seem pleased to see you. The ship moves in to attack, and it doesn't take long for you to realize this is one of the ships sent by the guards to hunt you down for attacking.

textList.name: TEXT_START_AEA_BIRD
textList.text: You have arrived in Gi space. The Gi may not be part of the federation, however they're still close allies and firmly against the rebellion. The Rebellion will still struggle to sneak its way into here.
You have arrived in Gi space. Lots of friendly faces will be here, but there will be plenty of Rebel scum invading as well.
You have arrived in Gi space. This may be a sector full of allies, but it is bound to attract plenty of Rebels too.

escape.text: They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.

event.name: TRANSPORT_AEA_BIRD_LOOT

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: This beacon hosts a Gi transport. It's safe to bet the ship is most likely carrying some special tech. If you can kill its crew, their cargo will be yours.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of their goods.

event.text: You prepare to secure their cargo by force.

choice.text: (Gi or Federation Elite + Good Reputation) Talk to the transport.

event.text: Your crew speaks to the transport's captain, explaining the importance of your mission. The transport's captain seems to understand, but also mentions the cargo they're carrying is vital to that same mission. If you're willing to pay in compensation, they're willing to make an exception.
The transaction is done. With the looks of it, this piece of equipment might prove useful.
You prepare to secure their cargo by force.
The transport captain shrugs and continues on their way.
They stay outside your weapons range, and eventually jump away.

event.name: TRANSPORT_CAPTURE_AEA_BIRD
event.text: The crew is dead, leaving you with the ship. Its cargo is yours for the taking. Aboard is the special tech you expected, which you bring back to your ship.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_AEA_BIRD
textList.text: "MAYDAY! MAYDAY! MAY-" The Federation captain's desperate cry for help is suddenly silenced by the destruction of their ship.
When future ships come across this wreck, it's likely people will assume this to be the job of Rebels or Pirates. But the trail will eventually lead to you.

It's a shame, seeing the brand new models of the Federation dispatched so quickly. When the Federation pushed to manufacture updated designs, they had conflict with Rebels in mind... but not necessarily their own hired Renegades.
You're struck by an eerie feeling as you watch a Federation ship get reduced to smithereens - but at least it wasn't your's.
One last explosion marks the Federation captain's fate as their ship is torn apart.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_AEA_BIRD
textList.text: A Federation crew has been downed. As you scrap their hull, you notice their radios are active, with command calling out to them still trying to understand what's happening. You mute the radio and continue.
"Man down, man down! Agh!" The crewmate's shouts go unheard as he is put down with the rest of his crew.

"This death of mine signifies the death of the Federation." The dying captain pauses as someone in the background shouts at him. "I am NOT overreacting! God damn it... you just had to ruin my final moments...".
"My name will be etched in a memorial for my service to the Multiverse... yours will be forever inscribed on a watchlist for the criminally deranged...".
"I never even... got my promotion! I'm not ready to die!" The Federation captain sobs into their hands as their crew fall one by one, ending with them.

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_AEA_BIRD
textList.text: "Continuing this any further would be madness - we're on the same side!".
The Federation ship is in tatters. You could probably negotiate their surrender at this point.
"Please, we don't have to do this! We're willing to give you anything to let us go!".
"Don't destroy us! We're Federation! At least let us surrender!".
"Take everything we have, just leave, and no more blood has to be spilt!".
The ship repeatedly hails you, pleading for you to stop your assault and let them go.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_AEA_BIRD_STATION
textList.text: "MAYDAY! MAYDAY! MAY-" The Federation captain's desperate cry for help is suddenly silenced by the destruction of the station.
When future ships come across this wreck, it's likely people will assume this to be the job of Rebels or Pirates. But the trail will eventually lead to you.

It's a shame, seeing the brand new models of the Federation dispatched so quickly. When the Federation pushed to manufacture updated designs, they had conflict with Rebels in mind... but not necessarily their own hired Renegades.

event.name: DEFEAT_AEA_BIRD_ELITE
event.text: Eliminating allies of the Federation, especially Elite ones, is highly contrary to your mission, but that doesn't mean you're beyond salvaging the remains.
It seems the cargo of the Elite Gi ship survived the fight. Inside is a functional drone, which you bring back on board.

destroyed.text: You've destroyed the fungus infected ship and collect anything useful from the remains.

deadCrew.text: You've cleared the infected ship of it's crew and scrap it for useful parts.
